intro: Veronica dorrien-smithii, commonly known as the Dorrien-Smith's speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the western regions of Australia. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has slender, upright stems with narrow leaves and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
